bug.author: yidongVSI
bug.summary: Block build error by UE4.18 on Ubuntu16.04
bug.description: Block build failed by UE4.18 on Ubuntu 16.04 The AirSim is in SHA 65f45b740ddabf9090b06f9dd23397dd61f4b064 Most of compile errors were from AirSim/Unreal/Environments/Blocks/Plugins/AirSim/Source/Weather/WeatherLib.h as below WeatherLib.h:55:10: error: no viable conversion from returned value of type 'const wchar_t [62]' to function return type 'const FSoftClassPath' return TEXT("AActor'/AirSim/Weather/WeatherFX/WeatherActor.WeatherActor_C'") WeatherLib.h:50:10: error: no viable conversion from returned value of type 'const wchar_t [49]' to function return type 'const FSoftClassPath' return TEXT("AActor'/AirSim/Weather/UI/MenuActor.MenuActor_C'") WeatherLib.h:60:10: error: no viable conversion from returned value of type 'const wchar_t [58]' to function return type 'const FSoftClassPath' return TEXT("UUserWidget'/AirSim/Weather/UI/OptionsMenu.OptionsMenu_C'") seems there is some version confliction between AirSim and Unreal Engine 4.18 ?? As I built Block example, I always got a warning message before building saying 'This project was made with a difference version of the Unreal Engine. Converting to this version will rebuild your code projects...' Thanks for any suggestions!

comments.comment: Same issue here, I am seeing it on Ubuntu 18.04.1 LTS when building blocks project. Thanks for looking at it.
Same issue here. Ubuntu 16.04.5 LTS with UE 4.18.2 when building blocks project.
Having the same issue as well. Ubuntu 16.04.3 LTS UE 4.18 AirSm v1.2.0Linux
closing as outdated wrt current master
